basics.name: Jiangang Hao, Ph.D.
basics.label: Research Director
basics.summary: Research Director at ETS leading the Assessment of Complex Skills program. Focus on leveraging AI, data analytics, and big data to understand people and interactions.

positions.name: Director, Assessment of Complex Skills Program
positions.summary: Led the Assessment of Complex Skills program to develop data analytics and AI-based solutions for complex skills such as collaboration, communication, and other social skills in classroom settings.
highlights: Led a community effort to analyze and document how LLMs and generative AI transform assessment.
Developed guidelines and researched new methods for responsible use of detectors of AI-generated texts.

positions.name: Director, Psychometric and Data Science Modeling
positions.summary: Led and grew the Psychometric and Data Science Modeling group, driving innovation in data science methods to extract insights from complex digital learning and assessment data.
highlights: Developed and implemented over 7 data analytics and AI solutions to enhance test security, achieving over 60% detection of cheating incidents.
Served on the corporate Test Security Leadership Team, guiding strategy for test security in remote testing environments.
Co-edited 'Computational Psychometrics', integrating data science, machine learning, and NLP with measurement principles.

positions.name: Managing Senior Research Scientist, Assessment Analytics and Data Science
positions.summary: Led the Assessment Analytics and Data Science group, developing new analytics methods and providing comprehensive data support and operational analysis.
highlights: Architected and led the development of the EPCAL Classroom version and cloud-based data analytics pipelines, supporting over five research projects.
Served on the ETS AI Strategy Committee, contributing to corporate AI strategy development.

positions.name: Senior Research Scientist, Psychometrics, Statistics and Data Science
positions.summary: Co-chaired the Research Advisory Council to lead the Measurement Frontier Research Initiative.
highlights: Developed the ETS Platform for Collaborative Assessment and Learning (EPCAL), supporting over 13 research projects.
Introduced the Evidence Trace File for virtual performance assessment and process data analysis.

positions.name: Research Scientist, Center for Computational Psychometrics
positions.summary: Pioneered innovative methods in computational psychometrics and assessment analytics.
highlights: Developed the ETS data model for virtual performance assessment to capture extensive process data.
Led the ETS Collaborative Science project, creating assessment tools showcased at the White House by the NCES commissioner.

positions.name: Visiting Scientist, Department of Physics
positions.summary: Developed pipelines for Dark Energy Survey CCDs.
highlights: Created a machine learning method utilizing image-based shape measurement for real-time feedback on the Dark Energy Survey camera alignment.

work.name: Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory
work.description: U.S. Department of Energy National Laboratory

positions.name: Postdoc, Center for Particle Astrophysics
positions.summary: Led the development of methods for astronomical data analysis and galaxy clustering.
highlights: Developed image-based methods to measure the flatness of the DECam focal plane.
Created the largest catalog of clustered galaxies using an unsupervised machine learning algorithm (GMBCG).

positions.name: Research Assistant, Department of Physics
positions.summary: Conducted research in astronomical data analysis using machine learning.
highlights: Developed an unsupervised machine learning algorithm (GMBCG) to detect galaxy clusters from astronomical data.
Created an error-corrected Gaussian Mixture Model algorithm to measure the spread of galaxy color distributions.
